Shocking really considering how much the students were paying for tuition -Higher ups would push their duties onto me and not take responsibility when things went wrong. Probably because they had no idea how to carry them out -Terrible pay

job_title: Laboratory Demonstrator in Portland, OR

job_title: Senior Lecturer in Montclair, NJ
pros: None..can I put 0 stars?
cons: Working in UCLan has been the most miserable experience of all my life. The level of the students admitted is embarassing low, with many having trouble with very elementary tasks like reading and writing. We are forced to inflate marks to achieve a staggering 90% pass rate. The standard is so low that I have serious difficulties in teaching to such weak students. Students have immense power and to avoid complaints they are kept happy resulting in cutting course content and lowering standards. Students repay by being lazy, not motivated and secure to end up with a degree. The way staff is treated by management is poor. Admin work is immense. Management, during the recent years, have made emarassing choices bringing the University and the moral of staff at a record low. Table leagues are affected by that (please check on websites). Staff and lecturers have no dignity, they are asked to be servants of students and dolls in the hand of management. Contact time is crazy high and there is no time for reasearch but UCLan put you underpressure for the incoming REF. Research is trivial and of low level and managers give out to you for this.. but there is no money for anything. PhD students are all self funded and very weak. Also managment protects certain minorities to avoid complaints and this ends up in a discrimination of a big portion  of staff not belonging to minorities. Location-wise is a disaster. Preston is a dull city and a dangerous one. Nothing going on, very boring. I will leave soon and I am glad.

job_title: Student Ambassador in Preston, North West England, England
pros: Can choose my own working hours
cons: Not really much to say

job_title: Senior QA Officer in Preston, North West England, England
pros: Excellent Ts and Cs and pay
cons: Lack of Personal Development investment

job_title: Medical Records in Fulwood, England
pros: It gave me the experience to work within an office and time to work out what I wanted to do after Graduation, It was also very encouraging when you consider how many went for the positions. It also looks good on my CV. I also gained a full time job with the NHS , which I wiuld not have had experience for had \i not got the internship
cons: I was given several staring times and when I was eventually taken on I had no real job specification and some days I  had no work as they appeared to have taken too many interns in my office and we were scrapping for work. I eneded up empying entire rooms of all out of date paper work, I didi this for 2 weeks solid!!! This was not only unacceptable but was against, in my opinion health and safety. I had to go round the office begging for work!!!

review_title: Avoid working at the library as a Student Shelver... On a zero hour contract especailly.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Henderson, NV
pros:
-Friendly enough working atmosphere

-I'm sure that if I had of worked in another department my experiences would have been much more positive.
cons:
-Full time staff 'down tools' when student workers arrive on shift. The full time library shelving staff basically do nothing, especially when the boss is not there.

-If you injure yourself at work there will be no help with getting home,  even if you are struggling to move, and they know you have to walk a mile across town to the bus station. You will just be sent home and have any future shifts cancelled just before Christmas.

-Felt under pressure to work additional shifts to cover for illness when asked by the boss, even though I had stated that I was getting behind with my Uni work.

job_title: Teacher in Preston, North West England, England
pros:
Great opportunity to learn and get further qualifications
Great facilities and city centre campus 
A good atmosphere to work most of the time
Reasonable rates of pay
Some flexiibility to work at home


Fantastic staff on an everyday level
cons:
No research opportunities AT ALL unless you are a paid researcher
Feel de skilled clinically as not teaching what I am trained to do
Restrictive job specifications and man management methods
Massive teaching and marking committments
Much less student contact due to online materials being video'd, essays now marked and fedback online,
Group supervision for essay development and fails model reduces satisfaction 
Massive number of students and a lack of staff

review_title: Not a place to start a research career
job_title: Research Associate in Preston, North West England, England
pros: The people you work with on a day to day level. Relatively good freedom in choosing projects/directing own research.
cons:
You need political power within the University to get anything done. You cannot stand on how good your work it or what you do for the University. Once they have had their use of you they will cast you aside.

Short term organisational thinking. No commitment to research (although they say they are). No commitment to continuing successful research when there is a short-term lapse in funding. There is no research career path. No training to help you move into lecturing. Lack of funding for research projects - although the University does have money. Needless bureaucracy. Staff are seen as a cost on a spreadsheet and not an asset to the University or person.

job_title: Cleaner in Kendal, England
pros: Good Location, Good facilities. Good Social living.
cons: Terrible staff attitudes. Unhelpful. Rude,  No respect for student wellbeing. Poor help and support sector as well.

review_title: Good and flexible place to work
job_title: Research Assistant in Preston, North West England, England
pros: Good work/life balance, with flexible hours. Managers are friendly and easy to approach. Each team I have worked with have been friendly and accommodating. supportive place to work.
cons:
Pay rate for interns could be better. 
Clarity between different teams could sometimes be improved. 
If someone is working with different teams, they need to have tasks assigned to them and be clear on the different tasks.

job_title: Lecturer ESOL/EFL in Preston, North West England, England
pros:
Flexible working patterns, good salary (especially considering that living costs in the area are much cheaper than in other parts of the UK), very supportive colleagues and approachable managers, some opportunities for personal development.
Good company culture and values.
cons:
Research is part of the job description (for lecturers), but most of the research work has to be done outside of working hours. Prep time (for teaching hours) has been reduced and marking time is ridiculously low.
Bureaucracy gets often in the way...

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Preston, North West England, England
pros: The facilities are good in regards of the gym and library. Some classrooms are usable; others are not, especially the ones at Vernon buildings are old and shabby.
cons: There are many cons. The handouts, teachings and lecturers are not up to the standard. The most being; sly and biased lecturers. Personally, I felt that the lecturer was under qualified and had poor teaching and marking ethics. There were these two lecturers who did not even read the student's assignments thoroughly and just assign an assumed grade. A student who had references from Wikipedia and had many grammar and spelling mistakes could score higher than someone who had used journals and books. That definitely says something.

review_title: Excellent employee support and lots of freedom to direct own projects.
job_title: Intern in Preston, North West England, England
pros: Open and friendly work environment with supportive management. Can be open and reasonably honest with management about their approach. Freedom to direct your own projects and be your own boss.
cons: Lack of opportunities to grow and develop into further employment within organisation. Limited prospects. Lack of staff diversity. Lack of budget for hiring more staff and introducing the required resources to help the team to achieve goals.

job_title: Human Resources Assistant

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Preston, North West England, England

job_title: Publications Officer in Preston, North West England, England
pros: The vast majority of staff are friendly and approachable. Unlike some larger universities, senior managers are approachable, down-to-earth and never egotistical. The pay is decent for the sector and there are some decent benefits (including 30 days holiday plus 4 extra days over Christmas, flexible working to some extent).
cons: The work culture is office-based, so very few staff work from home on a regular basis. More opportunities/encouragement to work from home would be a huge bonus.

review_title: UCLAN IS A GOOD PLACE TO WORK
